subtopics.name: Methodology
subtopics.description: The systematic procedures and techniques used in scientific research to ensure objectivity and reproducibility. This subtopic relates to Epistemology by addressing how knowledge is acquired and validated through rigorous methods, aligning with the foundational framework of scientific inquiry.

subtopics.name: Theoretical Frameworks
subtopics.description: The conceptual structures that underpin scientific theories and models. This subtopic connects to Ontology by exploring the nature of reality as understood through scientific constructs, which are essential for understanding the structure and content of scientific knowledge.

subtopics.name: Empirical Evidence
subtopics.description: The data collected through observation and experimentation that supports or refutes scientific hypotheses. This subtopic integrates with Cognitive Science by examining how humans perceive, process, and interpret data, which is crucial for generating and validating scientific knowledge.

subtopics.name: Ethical Considerations
subtopics.description: The moral principles guiding scientific research, including issues like informed consent, animal welfare, and data privacy. This subtopic aligns with Practical Wisdom by emphasizing the ethical application of knowledge in real-world contexts, ensuring that scientific inquiry is conducted responsibly.

subtopics.name: Interdisciplinary Collaboration
subtopics.description: The practice of combining insights from multiple scientific disciplines to address complex problems. This subtopic exemplifies Interdisciplinary Synthesis by highlighting the interconnectedness of all knowledge domains and encouraging holistic approaches to scientific inquiry.
